links.title: AlphaFold: a solution to a 50-year-old grand challenge in biology
links.description: In a major scientific advance, the latest version of our AI system AlphaFold has been recognised as a solution to this grand challenge by the organisers of the biennial Critical Assessment of protein Structure Prediction (CASP) assessment. This breakthrough demonstrates the impact AI can have on scientific discovery and its potential to dramatically accelerate progress in some of the most fundamental fields that explain and shape our world.
links.original_title: AlphaFold: a solution to a 50-year-old grand challenge in biology

Angstrom - Wikipedia
links.description: The angstrom[1][2][3][4] (/ˈæŋstrəm/, /ˈæŋstrʌm/;[3][5][6] ANG-strəm, ANG-strum[5]) or ångström[1][7][8][9] is a metric unit of length equal to 10−10 m; that is, one ten-billionth of a metre, 0.1 nanometre, or 100 picometres. Its symbol is Å, a letter of the Swedish alphabet.

links.title: Anfinsen's dogma - Wikipedia
links.description: Anfinsen's dogma (also known as the thermodynamic hypothesis) is a postulate in molecular biology that states that, at least for a small globular protein in its standard physiological environment, the native structure is determined only by the protein's amino acid sequence.[1] The dogma was championed by the Nobel Prize Laureate[2] Christian B. Anfinsen from his research on the folding of ribonuclease A.[3][4] The postulate amounts to saying that...

links.title: Dalton (unit) - Wikipedia
links.description: The dalton or unified atomic mass unit (symbols: Da or u) is a unit of mass widely used in physics and chemistry. It is defined as 1/12 of the mass of an unbound neutral atom of carbon-12 in its nuclear and electronic ground state and at rest.[1][2] The atomic mass constant, denoted mu  is defined identically, giving mu = m(12C)/12 = 1 Da.[3]

links.title: Hartree-Fock on a superconducting qubit quantum computer
links.description:
As the search continues for useful applications of noisy intermediate scale
quantum devices, variational simulations of fermionic systems remain one of the
most promising directions. Here, we perform a series of quantum simulations of
chemistry the largest of which involved a dozen qubits, 78 two-qubit gates, and
114 one-qubit gates. We model the binding energy of ${\rm H}_6$, ${\rm H}_8$,
${\rm H}_{10}$ and ${\rm H}_{12}$ chains as well as the i...

links.title: Four-Color Theorem -- from Wolfram MathWorld
links.description:
The four-color theorem states that any map in a plane can be colored using four-colors in such a way that regions sharing a common boundary
 (other than a single point) do not share the same color. This problem is sometimes
 also called Guthrie's problem after F. Guthrie,
 who first conjectured the theorem in 1852. The conjecture
 was then communicated to de Morgan and thence into the general community. In 1878,
 Cayley wrote the first paper on ...

links.title: Papers with Code - Beta-VAE Explained
links.description: Beta-VAE is a type of variational autoencoder that seeks to discovered disentangled latent factors. It modifies VAEs with an adjustable hyperparameter $\beta$ that balances latent channel capacity and independence constraints with reconstruction accuracy. The idea is to maximize the probability of generating the real data while keeping the distance between the real and estimated distributions small, under a threshold $\epsilon$. We can use the Ku...

links.title: Protein folding - Wikipedia
links.description: Protein folding is the physical process by which a protein chain acquires its native three-dimensional structure, a conformation that is usually biologically functional, in an expeditious and reproducible manner. It is the physical process by which a polypeptide folds into its characteristic and functional three-dimensional structure from a random coil.[1] Each protein exists as an unfolded polypeptide or random coil when translated from a sequen...

links.title: An evolution-based model for designing chorismate mutase enzymes
links.description: Protein sequences contain information specifying their three-dimensional structure and function, and statistical analysis of families of sequences has been used to predict these properties. links.title: De novo protein design by deep network hallucination
links.description: There has been considerable recent progress in protein structure prediction using deep neural networks to infer distance constraints from amino acid residue co-evolution[1][1]–[3][2]. We investigated whether the information captured by such networks is sufficiently rich to generate new folded proteins with sequences unrelated to those of the naturally occuring proteins used in training the models. We generated random amino acid sequences, and inp...

links.title: A bacterium that degrades and assimilates poly(ethylene terephthalate)

links.title: Standard cell - Wikipedia
links.description: In semiconductor design, standard cell methodology is a method of designing application-specific integrated circuits (ASICs) with mostly digital-logic features. Standard cell methodology is an example of design abstraction, whereby a low-level very-large-scale integration (VLSI) layout is encapsulated into an abstract logic representation (such as a NAND gate).  Cell-based methodology — the general class to which standard cells belong — makes it ...

links.title: Hauntology - Wikipedia
links.description: Hauntology (a portmanteau of haunting and ontology[1]) is a neologism introduced by French philosopher Jacques Derrida in his 1993 book Spectres of Marx. The concept refers to the return or persistence of elements from the past, as in the manner of a ghost. It has since been invoked in fields such as visual arts, philosophy, electronic music, politics, fiction and literary criticism.[2]

links.title: r/formula1 - I did a real fast 3d render for any doubters left. If there wasn't a halo the barrier would've hit him very hard.

links.title: Comment Google veut faire plier Bruxelles
links.description: Le géant américain déploie les grands moyens contre la législation numérique que l'Europe – en particulier Thierry Breton – souhaite instaurer. Révélations.

links.title: Mit harten Bandagen: Wie Google strengere Regeln für Internetplattformen verhindern will | LobbyControl
links.description: Eine kürzlich geleakte Lobbystrategie zeigt, wie aggressiv Google gegen die geplanten strengeren Regeln für digitale Plattformen vorgeht. Denn an strengeren Regeln ist der einflussreiche Digitalkonzer

links.title: How are pilots evaluated for raises or promotions?  - AskThePilot.com
links.description: This requires an understanding of the airline seniority system. In the United States and many other countries, all of a pilot’s quality-of-life variables are determined via seniority bidding, based on date of hire. Our destiny has almost nothing to do with merit and everything to do with timing. Experience and skill, for all of their […]

links.title: Google Launches IBM Power Systems as a Cloud Service
links.description: The service is aimed at legacy enterprise workloads. Google is the second major cloud provider to offer the option besides IBM.

links.title: AWS Inferentia - Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Majority of Alexa Now Running on Faster, More Cost-Effective Amazon EC2 Inf1 Instances | Amazon Web Services
links.description: Today, we are announcing that the Amazon Alexa team has migrated the vast majority of their GPU-based machine learning inference workloads to Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) Inf1 instances, powered by AWS Inferentia. This resulted in 25% lower end-to-end latency, and 30% lower cost compared to GPU-based instances for Alexa’s text-to-speech workloads. The lower latency […]

links.title: On Google, Apple and the computer industry’s struggle for innovation
links.description: Apple has been doing it for years, Google will do it as well: make their own chips and processors. This will affect the whole industry.

links.title: Do You Know How to Say Mathematics in Different Languages?
links.description: Looking for ways to say mathematics in other languages? Check out our list for saying mathematics in different languages. Be ready to meet a foreign friend!

links.title: Welcome to SymPy’s documentation! — SymPy 1.7 documentation
links.description: A PDF version of these docs can be found here.

links.title: Introduction — SymPy 1.7 documentation
links.description:
Symbolic computation deals with the computation of mathematical objects
symbolically.  This means that the mathematical objects are represented
exactly, not approximately, and mathematical expressions with unevaluated
variables are left in symbolic form.

links.title: Fourier transform of triangular function is not right · Issue #2803 · sympy/sympy
links.description: Both fourier_transform(cos(t),t,omega) and fourier_transform(cos(t),t,omega) return 0, which should be DiracDelta function. Check http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21202244/fourier-transform-in-sy...

links.title: fourier_transform(1, x, z) returns 0 · Issue #7178 · sympy/sympy
links.description: fourier_transform(1, x, z) returns 0, but it should return DiracDelta(z) Original issue for #7178: http://code.google.com/p/sympy/issues/detail?id=4079 Original author: https://code.google.com/u/11...

links.title: fourier_transform possibly wrong result · Issue #18136 · sympy/sympy
links.description: I'm trying to use Sympy for some school work and solving PDEs. I need to make the Fourier transform of function 1/(x^2+1). Sympy returns pi*exp(-2*pi*xi). This result however doesn't invers...

links.title: Google Colaboratory
IRS Says Its Own Error Sent $1,200 Stimulus Checks To Non-Americans Overseas
links.description: The IRS now says its own error caused thousands of non-Americans living overseas to mistakenly receive $1,200 stimulus checks — and the mistake could happen again if more stimulus money goes out.
links.original_title: IRS says its own error sent $1,200 stimulus checks to non-Americans overseas

links.title: Many Americans used part of their coronavirus stimulus check to trade stocks
links.description: People earning between $35,000 and $75,000 annually traded stocks about 90% more than the week after receiving their stimulus check.

links.title: Helicopter money - Wikipedia
Unemployment Scam Using Inmates’ Names Costs California Hundreds of Millions
links.description: Investigators say the payment of benefits claimed with the names of prisoners, including many on death row, “appears to be the most significant fraud on taxpayer funds in California history.”

links.title: 'No end in sight': hunger surges in America amid a spiraling pandemic
links.description: Unprecedented demand for food aid is on the rise as states across the country contemplate new lockdowns

links.title: U.S. has lost sight of cash from $70 billion sent to Afghanistan: Inspector General - Stripes Central - Stripes
links.description: Audit blasts U.S. mismanagement, corrupt Afghan bankers, even President Karzai

links.title: U.S. sent pallets of cash to Baghdad
links.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve sent record payouts of more than $4 billion in cash to Baghdad on giant pallets aboard military planes shortly before the United States gave control back to Iraqis, lawmakers said on Tuesday.

links.title: Investigation Into Missing Iraqi Cash Ended in Lebanon Bunker  (Published 2014)
links.description: Between $1.2 billion and $1.6 billion in Iraqi funds were stolen after the American invasion and moved to rural Lebanon, a former United States investigator said for the first time, but the trail ended there.

links.title: Germany should pay illegal migrants €1,500 in coronavirus aid and grant them amnesty, demands leftist party
links.description: 27 German MPs signed a letter asking for financial assistance to illegals, as well as granting them amnesty and suspension of deportations
